item.title: Preview Hugo on Mobile or Local Network
item.description: To preview hugo development website on mobile phone or local network, you need to tell hugo server to bind to baseUrl the your local IP address. Im my case hugo server --buildDrafts --bind 192.168.X.XXX --baseURL http://192.168.X.XXX If the IP address is assigned dynamically by the router, the command needs to be modified each time the address change.

item.title: Deploy Hugo to Firebase
item.description: Deploying website with Hugo. This is actualy very easy. From the project root directory, run: hugo -D This will populate the /public directory with updated content. Now the app is ready to be deployed to Firebase. Deploying to Firebase Create a project within a firebase console, and in the hosting section, follow the instruction to set up project name, etc… Then, from the console , project root directory run: firebase init to run interactive setup

item.title: Getting started with Hugo
item.description: Hugo is fast, Hugo is flexible, Hugo is simple Hugo is not about configuration and fancy styling like lot of Javascript libraries, Hugo is about content. Because quality content is still a king. And always will be. Let’s start with Hugo.
